titles.title: We Three Kings Of Orient Are

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: O star of wonder, star of night, newline Star with royal beauty bright; newline Westward leading, still proceeding, newline Guide us to Thy perfect light.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: We three kings of Orient are, newline Bearing gifts we traverse afar; newline Field and fountain moor and mountain, newline Following yonder star.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Born a King on Bethlehem's plain, newline Gold I bring to crown Him again; newline King forever, ceasing never, newline Over us all to reign.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: Frankincense to offer have I, newline Incense owns a Deity nigh; newline Prayer and praising, all men raising, newline Worship Him, God on high.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Myrrh is mine, its bitter perfume, newline Breathes a life of gathering gloom; newline Sorrowing, sighing, bleeding, dying, newline Sealed in the stone cold tomb.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Glorious now behold Him arise, newline King and God and sacrifice; newline Alleluia, alleluia! newline Earth to heav'n replies.
